description: Hand-written diary bound in black leather, with elastic strap to secure closed (now very stretched and ineffectual). Printed with vertial and horizontal lines. Inside covers is decorative lining of purple pattern. Writing is principally in ink, with some pencil inscriptions. Includes sketches of battlefields. Part of the front page has been torn off and is missing.
keywords: Psychiatric Patients,Wars & Conflicts,World War I, 1914-1918,Making History - War Diaries and Correspondence
